Package com.accele.gage

Class GameConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.GameConfiguration
  • public class GameConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    The primary settings for the engine.

    This class contains engine-wide settings such as the engine version, current FPS, current ticks per second, and others. These settings can be read from externally using a GameConfigurationReader and written to externally using a GameConfigurationWriter.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the current version of the engine.

        The version number is split into three parts: major, minor, and revision.

        1. Major updates are changes to the API that do not maintain backwards compatibility. Deprecated features will be removed.
        2. Minor updates are changes to the API that also maintain backwards compatibility. Previous features that should not be used will be marked as deprecated.
        3. Revision updates are bug fixes only; they do not indicate any critical API changes.
        Returns:
        the current version of the engine

      • getFps

        public int getFps()
        Returns the number of frames per second the engine will run at. The engine will attempt to render as fast as the implementing system will allow, so this value is determined by the system's capabilities.
        Returns:
        the number of frames per second the engine will run at

      • getTicksPerSecond

        public double getTicksPerSecond()
        Returns the number of ticks per second the engine will run at. The default value is 25.0.
        Returns:
        the number of ticks per second the engine will run at

      • setTicksPerSecond

        public void setTicksPerSecond​(double ticksPerSecond)
        Sets the number of ticks per second the game loop will run at. Calling this method after calling start() will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        ticksPerSecond - the number of ticks per second the game loop should run at

      • doEntityCollision

        public boolean doEntityCollision()
        Returns whether the EntityHandler should perform entity collision detection.
        Returns:
        whether the EntityHandler should perform entity collision detection

      • setEntityCollision

        public void setEntityCollision​(boolean doEntityCollision)
        Sets whether the EntityHandler should perform entity collision detection.

        Note that this method will not change the value until the end of the current game loop cycle.

        Parameters:
        doEntityCollision - whether the EntityHandler should perform entity collision detection

      • useDefaultTextureParameters

        public void useDefaultTextureParameters()
        Specifies that the engine should use the default texture parameters when creating new instances of Texture.

        GAGE uses the following default values:

        Default Texture Parameters
        Parameter Value
        GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_SGL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE
        GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_TGL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE
        GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTERGL_LINEAR
        GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTERGL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR

      • useDefaultRepeatingTextureParameters

        public void useDefaultRepeatingTextureParameters()
        Specifies that the engine should use the default repeating texture parameters when creating new instances of Texture.

        GAGE uses the following default values:

        Default Repeating Texture Parameters
        Parameter Value
        GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_SGL_REPEAT
        GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_TGL_REPEAT
        GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTERGL_LINEAR
        GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTERGL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
